question_text:
Is home range size information available for your Target Species (can be taken from the literature)? 
If so, enter the home range diameter (in metres)
Do you plan to strategically place camera locations to include multiple habitats or otherwise differing categories (e.g., different land cover types, or near vs. far from a disturbance)

If so, how many covariates?
(e.g., 5 different habitat types would be 5 covariates)
How many independent detections?
How rare or common is the Target Species?
Is the Target Species a carnivore or ungulate?
Does the Target Species occur in low density?
Will you collect multiple samples from the same location?

Is the data overdispersed?
(Poisson GLM vs. negative binomial model)
Is the data zero-inflated?

Try using a zero-inflated model. Is overdispersion still present when accounting for by zero-inflation?
(i.e., is the zero-inflated model still overdispersed)
Are you using / Do you plan to use mixed models?
Try including a random effect for "Camera Location." Is the data still zero-inflated when accounting for a "Camera Location" random effect?
Do you believe that another process may be contributing to excess zeros? [need to rephrase]
Are ALL or a SUBET individuals naturally/artifically marked?

Are there 3+ categories of traits that can be be used to identify individuals? (i.e., information used to identify individuals that can be divided into distinct groups, e.g, sex class, age class, coat colour, markings and antler point count; Clarke et al., 2023)
Can additional information be collected/accessed? If so, what type?
Can counts of individuals be determined?
Focal area measured or detections binned by distance?
repeat
Is the study population large?
Are you using / Do you plan to use mixed models?
Was the Camera Direction either random or consistent?
How many individuals were detected?
How many recaptures were detected?
Will you place Camera Locations across a known density gradient?
Can cameras be deployed close together (i.e., high camera density)?
How detectable is the Target Species?
Is the distribution of the Target Species highly restricted?
Do you wish to sample long enough to reach the species-accumulation asymptote?
What is the approximate size of the Target Species?
Will each camera location be treated as an independent sample?
What's your objective? Select "Unknown" if you're not sure.
Do you have a limited number of cameras?
If so, how many?
Do you plan to use data from multiple study areas?
Is there a minimum number of months you can sample in total?
If so, how many?
Is there a maximum number of months you can sample?
If so, how many?
How many seasons will the study contain?
Are you sampling for a single species or multiple?
How well is the biology about of the Target Species known?
If so, enter the home range diameter (in metres)
Is the Target Species known or likely to investigate the camera (e.g., moose, coyote) or be camera shy (e.g., lynx)?
Does the [or one of the, if multiple] Target Species' behaviour vary by season?

Do individuals have natural or artificial marks such that they can be uniquely identified? 
(i.e. are the individuals, population, or species "marked," "unmarked," or "partially marked")
Do you plan to use cameras of the same make and model?

Do you plan to use data from cameras with different settings?
(e.g., if pooling data from multiple studies, protocols for camera settings may differ)
Was the placement Camera Height and Camera Angle consistent or variable across Camera Locations?
Do you plan to use bait or lure? If so, will you use the same type of bait or lure, or multiple types?
Will bait/lure be placed at all or a subset of Camera Locations?

Do you plan to target specific feature(s)? 
(e.g., facing the camera towards a game trail or mineral lick)
Will all cameras target the same feature?
